bibl.title: The Multilingual Environment of Late Antique Egypt: Greek, Latin, Coptic, and Persian Documentation.
bibl.note: Pehlevi: Languages in Contact without Interaction. - Latin: Diglossia with Limited or Imperfect Bilingualism: Latin in Egypt and Imperial Policy; - Conditions of the Use of Latin: Superficial Bilingualism or Diglossia; - Consequences of Latino-Greek Bilingualism or Diglossia. - Coptic: Diglossia with Real Bilingualism: The Birth of Coptic; - Coptic versus Greek; - Some Aspects of Coptic Literacy in Greek.
